summary: Brie Larson posted to her Instagram story that the press tour is over and you know she's been like nonstop busy for over the...
body:
Brie Larson posted to her Instagram story that the press tour is over and you know she’s been like nonstop busy for over the past year because of filming Endgame, training and filming for Captain Marvel, then doing press for both, back to back.

I hope she enjoys her downtime because she deserves it so much! Treat yourself, Captain! We love you and are proud of you! Also yes, it is a win for introverts everywhere hahaha.

reblog.comment:

summary:
My suitemate: if you could choose any female actor to be Bond who would it be
Me, without hesitation: Brie Larson
My suitemate:...
body:
My suitemate: if you could choose any female actor to be Bond who would it be

Me, without hesitation: Brie Larson

My suitemate: oh damn with her endgame haircut?

Me: okay wait hear me out Tessa Thompson as Bond and Brie Larson as Bond girl with her endgame haircut

My suitemate: oh hell yes

Me: they would do it!

summary: ‘Avengers: Endgame’ Review: A Satisfying, Epic End
title: ‘Avengers: Endgame’ Review: A Satisfying, Epic End
body:
It’s finally here, the closing chapter of an unprecedented 11-year, 22-film journey that began in 2008 with a C-list Marvel hero, a washed-up movie star and the director of Elf. And make no mistake, Avengers: Endgame is the definitive conclusion to the Marvel Cinematic Universe up to this point and it’s difficult to imagine a more fitting one.

As far as the story here goes, it’s difficult to be…

View On WordPress

summary: Reasons why I hate Captain Marvel (as a girl)
title: Reasons why I hate Captain Marvel (as a girl)
body:
reposting this from an ask I answered bc this way I can actually tag this shit.

She is overpowered, and overpowered characters are really difficult to pull off properly. She isn’t relatable, which is ironic for a character who is supposed to be the ultimate “female representation”. I don’t feel represented by her, I feel infantilized and frankly sickened that both Brie and the directors/producers think that their character shouldn’t have any flaws in order to not be called sexist.

-

Strong and empowered doesn’t mean inhuman or without flaws. Strong and empowered doesn’t mean “THE STRONGEST IN THE WHOLE UNIVERSE WITH THE POWER OF THE STAAAAAAARS AND NO ACTUAL FLAWS”. Especially because it makes every. single. plot. involving her seem so boring and bland, like you have to manufacture bullshit excuses for there to be any tension in battles whatsoever because technically, the character is a god and nothing should be able to beat her. [SPOILERS  FOR ENDGAME] There is a point in Endgame where she fights Thanos, and she loses/is tossed aside. Which makes no sense considering what her moveset is supposed to be. Thanos SHOULD NOT BE a challenge to Carol, at all, yet he is, because plot. This shouldn’t happen, and it’s the problem with OP characters, they are way too powerful so every challenge feels fake and hollow [END OF SPOILERS]

-

Then there’s also the retconning thing. I hate retconning. It’s lazy. Out of nowhere this deus ex machina pops up like she’s supposedly been there all along, and she’s the “most powerful” avenger and all that bullshit. We didn’t need any more strong Avengers, we have so many.

Then there’s how she was advertised as the first female hero etc etc. Well sorry that we forgot about:

-Scarlet Witch/Wanda Maximoff (who is a very strong woman with the power of the mindstone, already borderline OP, but offset by the fact that she’s an interesting character and her battles aren’t insta-wins. She feels like a whole ass character with good parts and bad parts and I love her)

-Gamora (who is a goddamn amazing character, amazing fighter)

-Nebula (who is also great, a joy to watch, both Gamora and Nebula grow SO MUCH as characters)

-Pepper Potts (WHO GETS SHIT DONE and is highly important behind the scenes, the only voice of reason around here)

-Black Widow/Natasha Romanov (who kicks ass and takes names, and has an interesting backstory.)

-Mantis (who kicks names and takes ass)

-Okoye (who, as much as I hate Black Panther, is a cool fighter, good with spear, not unnecessarily OP)

-Valkyrie and Sif (who are also cool, Valkyrie is rad, and she has a pegasus, so double rad. Sif is also strong.)

-Hela (not a hero but cool and strong anyways)

and that’s just off the top of my head. X-Men definitely has a couple more. Shuri doesn’t count for me because she also suffers from “OP retcon syndrome” and is actually racist lmfao.

-

Onwards….
The advertising is fucking bullshit. Give one of these ladies a standalone instead of this brand new character who we haven’t see in the MCU yet. Black Widow standalone, anyone? I know we’re getting a Wanda/Vision spin off and I am so here for that. But we didn’t need to introduce a whole ass new character just before Endgame, and then give her screentime in endgame, which for all intents and purposes was supposed to be the bookend for our existing characters.

Plus, I think it’s sexist to focus solely on the gender of a character. A character isn’t automatically great cause they’re female. Females aren’t saints. I am not a baby and I don’t need to be spoon-fed “representation”, because I can empathize with characters regardless of if they have a dick or a vag. As soon as the dick or the vag becomes a focus, we have a problem. We don’t need to be dumbed down into gender boxes.

-

Aside from that and on a more petty note Brie Larson can’t act, not well, and she’s a stuck up person with an ego bigger than any star. Maybe some of y’all think she’s attractive or whatever, and I mean, fine, that’s your right, just as it’s your right to like her etc., I personally think she sucks. And I just can’t get behind her. She refuses to accept criticism (just like a lot of you), “It isn’t made for you” isn’t a valid shield, you can’t just call all your critics trolls or generalize them all to be men. I’m a girl. And I hate her and the movie. Checkmate Brie.

summary: I was going to try to make a post aimed directly at one of your anons about how insane it is to say Brie Larson is cocky but I...
question: I was going to try to make a post aimed directly at one of your anons about how insane it is to say Brie Larson is cocky but I decided to just ask the genuine question of how many other MCU leads have an Oscar?

summary: Am I the only one who doesn't think Brie Larson is ruining the Avengers or mcu?? Like she's kinda bitchy, and kinda lied about...
body: Am I the only one who doesn’t think Brie Larson is ruining the Avengers or mcu?? Like she’s kinda bitchy, and kinda lied about doing her own stunts (I think??), but not the worst person and nothing new when it comes to politics and celebrities.

blog.title: Movie Archive
blog.description: Movies touch our hearts and awaken our vision, and change the way we see things. They take us to other places, they open doors and minds. Movies are the memories of our lifetime, we need to keep them alive. - Martin Scorsese

summary: 'this is cute and all but she's had a boyfriend for ages' So bi people aren't a thing? Cool.
question: 'this is cute and all but she's had a boyfriend for ages' So bi people aren't a thing? Cool.
answer:
don’t get me wrong, i didn’t mean that at all!

the post is implying that she might be “gay” and i took that as meaning, yk, full-on lesbian. (and i’ve known she’s had a bf cuz i follow her on ig)

but, gay or bi, i’m all for it! 

didn’t mean to be bi-phobic and/or contribute to bi-erasure. i’ll definitely weigh my words more carefully from now on.
